revised_title: A Firsthand Account of a Devastating Hailstorm in Hitchin, 1697
tldr: In a letter to Hans Sloan, Robert Tailor describes a massive hailstorm that hit Hitchin, Hertfordshire, on May 4th, 1697. The storm caused significant damage, with hailstones ranging from one to fourteen inches in size. The town suffered an estimated £4000 in damages, making it one of the most devastating hailstorms in history.
